full_summary:
### Government Tender Announcement

#### Procurement Title
Defining Audience Accessibility Needs

#### Brief Description
The Canadian Museum of Nature (CMN) invites experienced service providers to submit a proposal for defining the accessibility needs of visitors to the museum's main building. 

The successful provider will identify possible solutions to remove barriers and will engage in meaningful consultation with persons with disabilities in the National Capital Region (NCR).

#### Government Agency Contact
[Contracting Entity]
- Name: Canadian Museum of Nature
- Address: PO Box 3443, Station D, Ottawa, ON, K1P 6P4, Canada
- Email: [Approvisionnement-procurement@nature.ca](mailto:Approvisionnement-procurement@nature.ca)
- Phone: 613-566-4240

#### Procurement Details
- Reference Number: cb-927-77045130
- Amendment Number: 1
- Solicitation Number: 24-035-RFP
- Publication Date: 2024-06-14
- Tender Closing Date: July 12, 2024, at 16:00:00
- Expected Contract Start Date: July 29, 2024
- Expected Contract End Date: October 31, 2024

#### Procurement Description
Submit proposals electronically through the Bonfire platform located at https://cmn-mcn.bonfirehub.ca/opportunities/81277. All bid submissions and registration are free of charge. Bidders must first register on the platform and submit their bids on or before the tender closing date to be considered.

#### Procurement Requirements
- Unspsc Codes: 80171502 and 80171504
- Procurement Category: Service
- Notice Type: Request for Proposal
- Procurement Method: Competitive, Open Bidding
- Selection Criteria: Highest Combined Rating of Technical Merit and Price

#### Contact Information
Michelle Garber, Procurement Officer  
Partnership for Procurement, Contracting Entities, Canadian Museum of Nature  
Email: <Approvisionnement-procurement@nature.ca>, Phone: (613) 566-4240.  
1-800-354-8010 (for technical help). 

Note: The points that I changed include:
- Rearranged and restructured information into clear subheadings  
- Removed redundant information
- Corrected typos in governmental document but also verified information to ensure that such corrections did not compromise its integrity  
- Stronger structure with correct formatting and stronger
